content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> has the property that each time the output values increase by <math alttext="4"><semantics><mn>4</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, the corresponding input value is <math alttext="4"><semantics><mn>4</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> times greater. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label:
The x axis ranges from 0 to 8 in increments of 1.

The y axis ranges from negative 4 to 3 in increments of 1. 

All coordinates are approximate. 

Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (0.1 comma negative 4.5).

The curve increases sharply to cross the x axis (1 comma 0).

The curve continues to increase to pass through (4 comma 1) and exit the window at (8.5 comma 1.5).

The x axis ranges from 0 to 8 in increments of 1. 

They axis ranges from negative 4 to 6 in increments of 1.

All coordinates are approximate. 

Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (0.2 comma negative 4.5).

The curve increases to cross the x axis at (1 comma 0).

The curve continues to increase to pass through (2 comma 2), (4 comma 4), and (8 comma 6).

The curve exits the window at (8.5 comma 6.1).

The x axis ranges from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. 

The y axis ranges from 0 to 8 in increments of 1. 

All coordinates are approximate. 

Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 4.5 comma 0.1).

The curve nearly follows the x axis and then crosses the y axis at (0 comma 1).

The curve continues to increase to pass through (1 comma 4) then exit the window at (1.5 comma 8.5).

The x axis ranges from negative 4 to 6 in increments of 1. 

The y axis ranges from 0 to 8 in increments of 1.

All coordinates are approximate. 

Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (negative 4.5 comma 0.2).

The curve gradually increases to cross the y axis at (0 comma 1).

The curve continues to increase to pass through (2 comma 2), (4 comma 4), and (6 comma 8), at which point it exits the window.

content.answer:
The x axis ranges from 0 to 8 in increments of 1. 

They axis ranges from negative 4 to 6 in increments of 1.

All coordinates are approximate. 

Moving from left to right:

The curve enters the window at (0.2 comma negative 4.5).

The curve increases to cross the x axis at (1 comma 0).

The curve continues to increase to pass through (2 comma 2), (4 comma 4), and (8 comma 6).

The curve exits the window at (8.5 comma 6.1).

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
